question: A paper about AI regulation that was originally submitted to arXiv.org in June 2022 shows a figure with three axes, where each axis has a label word at both ends. Which of these words is used to describe a type of society in a Physics and Society article submitted to arXiv.org on August 11, 2016?

1. An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation
   URL: https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.01510

   Content: [2207.01510] Fairness in Agreement With European Values: An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation Skip to main content We gratefully acknowledge support from the Simons Foundation, member institutions , and all contributors. Donate > cs > arXiv:2207.01510 Help | Advanced Search All fields Title Author Abstract Comments Journal reference ACM classification MSC classification Report number arXiv identifier DOI ORCID arXiv author ID Help pages Full text Search open search GO open navigation menu quick links Login Help Pages About Computer Science > Computers and Society arXiv:2207.01510 (cs) [Submitted on 8 Jun 2022] Title: Fairness in Agreement With European Values: An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation Authors: Alejandra Bringas Colmenarejo , Luca Nannini , Alisa Rieger , Kristen M. Scott , Xuan Zhao , Gourab K. Patro , Gjergji Kasneci , Katharina Kinder-Kurlanda View a PDF of the paper titled Fairness in Agreement With European Values: An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation, by Alejandra Bringas Colmenarejo and 7 other authors View PDF Abstract: With increasing digitalization, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming ubiquitous. AI-based systems to identify, optimize, automate, and scale solutions to complex economic and societal problems are being proposed and implemented. This has motivated regulation efforts, including the Proposal of an EU AI Act. This interdisciplinary position paper considers various concerns surrounding fairness and discrimination in AI, and discusses how AI regulations address them, focusing on (but not limited to) the Proposal. We first look at AI and fairness through the lenses of law, (AI) industry, sociotechnology, and (moral) philosophy, and present various perspectives. Then, we map these perspectives along three axes of interests: (i) Standardization vs. Localization, (ii) Utilitarianism vs. Egalitarianism, and (iii) Consequential vs. Deontological ethics which leads us to identify a pattern of common a

3. arXiv:1904.09267v1 [physics.soc-ph] 19 Apr 2019
   URL: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1904.09267
   Site: arxiv.org
   Summary: by SC Lera · 2019 · Cited by 4 — Throughout most of Homo sapiens 300'000 year record, humans have lived in small-scale, mostly egalitarian hunter- gatherer societies, comprising ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
The June 2022 AI regulation paper maps views along axes including Utilitarianism vs Egalitarianism, and the August 11, 2016 Physics and Society article discusses egalitarian versus hierarchical societies, so the overlapping word is egalitarian.

FINAL ANSWER: egalitarian
